description.narrative: El objetivo general es reducir los niveles de violencia en Guyana fortaleciendo los esfuerzos para prevenir, ycontrolar los factores asociados con actos delictivos y la violencia, desarrollando intervenciones comunitarias con atencion especial a jovenes en riesgo en la sociedad,a si como fortalecer las capacidades de manejo del crimen a los niveles local y nacional.

The general objective is to reduce levels of violence in Guyana by strengthening efforts to prevent, counteract and control factors associated with criminal acts and violence, by developing community interventions with special attention to "at risk" youths throughout society, as well as strengthening crime management capabilities at the local and national levels.

activity-description.narrative: A comprehensive training scheme was implemented for the Guyana Police Force. The objective of the scheme is to transform the GPF from an incident-driven, reactive institution to one that relies on the analysis of patterns, incidents and problems to ensure sustainable solutions.

A national Safe Neighbourhood Survey was completed in 2011 to inform future policies and to provide data against which Programme effects can be measured. The survey captured information regarding (a) prevalence of agressive and other violeance related behaviours; (b) personal attitudes towards agression; (c) self - efficacy for alternatives to violence;(d) public perceptions of social institutions and the government amongst other areas.

A new computer classroom was built and equipped in the Felix Austin Police Training College. Police and recruits will use the facility for training in the use of the new crime information software, case management and information management as part of the institutional modernisation of the GPF.

A new training facility was consructed for the Guyana Police Force to support the the capacity building and training exercises for the GPF. The facility provides spacious classrooms equipped with teaching aids for police recruits, ranks and senior officers.
As part of the capacity building and modernisation of the Guyana Police Force, new crime prevention strategies were developed and are being implemented at the national and local levels.
Beneficiaries from ten(10) communities in Guyana were trained in the areas of violence prevention, personal development and anger management.

Building repairs and rehabilitation of the Springlands Police Station was completed as part of an intervention to improve services to citizens reporting crimes and to improve the crime prevention capabilities of the Police.
Building repairs and rehabilitation works were completed on the Alberttown Station to improve services to citizens reporting crime and improving crime prevention capabilities.
Building repairs and rehabilitation works were completed on the Albion Police Station to improve services to citizens reporting crime and improving crime prevention capabilities
Building repairs and rehabilitation works were completed on the Brickdam Police Station to improve services to citizens reporting crime and improving crime prevention capabilities.
Building repairs and rehabilitation works were completed on the Central New Amsterdam Police Station to improve services to citizens reporting crime and improving crime prevention capabilities.
Building repairs and rehabilitation works were completed on the East La Penitence Police Station to improve services to citizens reporting crime and improving crime prevention capabilities.
Building repairs and rehabilitation works were completed on the Grove Police Station to improve services to citizens reporting crime and improving crime prevention capabilities
Building repairs and rehabilitation works were completed on the Kitty Police Station to improve services to citizens reporting crime and improving crime prevention capabilities
Building repairs and rehabilitation works were completed on the Police Station at Nr. 51to improve services to citizens reporting crime and improving crime prevention capabilities.
Building repairs and rehabilitation works were completed on the Reliance Police Station to improve services to citizens reporting crime and improving crime prevention capabilities.
Building repairs and rehabilitation works were completed on the Ruimveldt Police Station to improve services to citizens reporting crime and improving crime prevention capabilities
Building repairs and rehabilitation works were completed on the Whim Police Station to improve services to citizens reporting crime and improving crime prevention capabilities
Integrated Crime Information System implemented in Guyana Police Force Headquarters Data Centre. The new software and hardware links police stations in Guyana and consolidates crime data.
New IT equipment and integrated crime information system software were provided to the Guyana Police Force to improve the overall institutional performance and modernisation of the GPF.

Rehabilitation of multi-purpose facility at Agricola. The facility provides community based interventions in: (1) youth life skills/vocational training, (2) violence prevention, (3) rapid impact projects, and (4) community engagement activities.

Rehabilitation of multi-purpose facility at Albion. The facility provides community based interventions in: (1) youth life skills/vocational training, (2) violence prevention, (3) rapid impact projects, and (4) community engagement activities.

Rehabilitation of multi-purpose facility at Angoy's Avenue was completed to provide community based interventions in: (1) youth life skills/vocational training, (2) violence prevention, (3) rapid impact proyects, and (4) community engagement activities

Rehabilitation of multi-purpose facility at Buxton. The facility provides community based intervention in: (1) youth life skills/vocational training, (2) violence prevention, (3) rapid impact projects, and (4) community engagement activities.

Rehabilitation of multi-purpose facility at Edinburg. The facility provides community based interventions in: (1) youth life skills/vocational training, (2) violence prevention, (3) rapid impact projects, and (4) community engagement activities.

Rehabilitation of multi-purpose facility at Kilcoy was completed to provide community based interventions in: (1) youth life skills/vocational training, (2) violence prevention, (3) rapid impact proyects, and (4) community engagement activities

Rehabilitation of multi-purpose facility at Lusignan. The facility provides community based interventions in: (1) youth life skills/vocational training, (2) violence prevention, (3) rapid impact projects, and (4) community engagement activities.

Rehabilitation of multi-purpose facility at Port Mourant. The facility provides community based interventions in: (1) youth life skills/vocational training, (2) violence prevention, (3) rapid impact proyects, and (4) community engagement activities.

Rehabilitation of multi-purpose facility at Sophia. The facility provides community based interventions in: (1) youth life skills/vocational training, (2) violence prevention, (3) rapid impact projects, and (4) community engagement activities.

Rehabilitation of multi-purpose facility. The facility provides community based interventions in: (1) youth life skills/vocational training, (2) violence prevention, (3) rapid impact projects, and (4) community engagement activities.

Rehabilitation of the multi-purpose facility at Plaisance. The facility provides community based interventions in: (1) youth life skills/vocational training, (2) violence prevention, (3) rapid impact projects, and (4) community engagement activities.

Residents of the high risk community of Plaisance were exposed to violence prevention skills and activities aimed at stregthening social cohesion within their community and improve their violence preventive capacity.

The Guyana's first dedicated forensic laboratory for the Guyana Police Force is being constructed on the campus of the University of Guyana. The fully equipped Forensic Lab when completed will improve the investigation and detection of crime in Guyana.
The Police Station at East La Penitence was rehabilitated as part of an intervention to improve services to citizens reporting crimes and to improve the crime prevention capabilities of the Police.
The Police Station at Timehri was rehabilitated as part of an intervention to improve services to citizens reporting crimes and to improve the crime prevention capabilities of the Police.
The Providence Police Station is one of eighteen police stations remodelled and refurbished under the operation.
The Strategic Plan for the Modernisation of the Ministry of Home Affairs was completed to strengthen MOHA's capacity and improve overall institutional capacity.
The construction of a basketball court at Agricola was completed under the community action component to improve community cohesiveness and increase community engagement activities.
The construction of a basketball court in Buxton was completed under the community action component to improve community cohesiveness and increase community engagement activities.
The construction of a fence and pavilion at Tain was completed under the community action component to improve community cohesiveness and increase community engagement activities.
The construction of a library in Rosehall was completed under the community action component to improve community cohesiveness and increase community engagement activities.
The construction of the Pavilion at Glasgow was completed under the community action component to improve community cohesiveness and increase community engagement activities.
The equipping of the enclosure of a building in Angoy's Avenue was completed under the community action component to improve community cohesiveness and increase community engagement activities.

The equipping of the of multi-purpose facility at Kilcoy was completed to provide community based interventions in: (1) youth life skills/vocational training, (2) violence prevention, (3) rapid impact proyects, and (4) community engagement activities
The improvements to the Courbane Park Playfield was completed under the community action component to improve community cohesiveness and increase community engagement activities.
The improvements to the Sparendaam Housing Scheme Playfield was completed under the community action component to improve community cohesiveness and increase community engagement activities.

The operation funded the construction of a new training facility in Georgetown for the Guyana Police Force as part of the mechanism to improve the capacity and modernize the Guyana Police Force. The facility includes modern classrooms, lecture theatres and amenities to improve classroom teaching sessions.
The rehabilitation of the Pattensen Community Centre was completed under the community action component to improve community cohesiveness and increase community engagement activities.
